sections.name: Governance (GV)
sections.template: Answer questions about CSF governance requirements. Focus on organizational context, risk management strategy, roles and responsibilities, policies, and oversight. Reference specific GV subcategories when applicable.

questions.question: What are the key governance activities in CSF 2.0?
questions.instructions: Look for GV.OC, GV.RM, GV.RR, GV.PO, GV.SC categories

questions.question: How should organizations establish cybersecurity risk management strategy?

sections.name: Identify (ID)
sections.template: Answer questions about asset management, risk assessment, and improvement activities. Reference specific ID subcategories.

questions.question: What assets should be inventoried according to CSF?
How should organizations conduct risk assessments?

sections.name: Protect (PR)
sections.template: Answer questions about safeguards for critical infrastructure. Focus on identity management, access control, awareness training, data security, and platform security.

questions.question: What are the identity management requirements?
What data security controls are recommended?

sections.name: Detect (DE)
sections.template: Answer questions about continuous monitoring and adverse event analysis. Reference DE subcategories.

questions.question: What continuous monitoring activities are required?

sections.name: Respond (RS)
sections.template: Answer questions about incident response activities including management, analysis, reporting, and mitigation.

questions.question: What are the incident response requirements?
questions.instructions: Look for RS.MA, RS.AN, RS.CO, RS.MI subcategories

sections.name: Recover (RC)
sections.template: Answer questions about recovery planning and execution after cybersecurity incidents.

questions.question: What recovery activities should organizations plan for?
questions.instructions: Look for RC.RP and RC.CO subcategories
